alert.note: Alert for Kootenai, Cabinet Region; Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 9:26PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mineral and west central Sanders Counties through 1000 PM MDT... At 925 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mullan, or 7 miles northeast of Wallace, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain, winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thompson Falls, Haugan, De Borgia, Saltese, Belknap, East Portal and Taft. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 0 and 19. Highway 200 W between mile markers 40 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Kootenai, Cabinet Region; Lower Clark Fork Region
